revised_title: Magnetic Influence in Solar Rays and its Effect on Magnetized Needles
tldr: The author, Samuel Hunter Christie, conducted experiments to study the magnetic influence in solar rays and its effect on a magnetized needle. He discovered that the solar rays have sensible magnetic properties that can be observed in the vibrations of a magnetized needle, independently of the heat they impart. The author also found that an increase in temperature causes a decrease in the intensity of the needle, and that the capacity of brass for developing magnetism by induction is diminished by an increase in temperature.
